findings.title: ST - Stops Transactions
findings.description: The contract owner has the authority to stop transactions for all users excluding the owner, potentially by setting `_maxTxAmount` to zero.

findings.title: ELFM - Exceeds Fees Limit
findings.description: The contract owner has the authority to increase fees over the allowed limit of 25% by calling setTransferBuyFee, setFeeDistribution, and setFeeSwap functions with a high percentage value.

findings.title: ULTW - Transfers Liquidity to Team Wallet
findings.description: The contract owner can set totalFee to zero, allowing them to swap contract tokens to native currency and send the swapped amount to marketingFeeReceiver.

findings.title: MT - Mints Tokens
findings.description: The minter role has the authority to mint tokens up to 10000000000 tokens which are 330% more than the initial supply. The owner may take advantage of it by calling the `mint` function, resulting in highly inflated contract tokens.

findings.title: BC - Blacklists Addresses
findings.description: The contract's authorized users have the authority to stop addresses from transactions. The owner may take advantage of it by calling the `devListAddress` function.

findings.title: ZD - Zero Division
findings.description: The contract is using variables that may be set to zero as denominators, leading to unpredictable and potentially harmful results, such as a transaction revert.

findings.title: PVC - Price Volatility Concern
findings.description: The contract accumulates tokens from taxes to swap them for ETH, but the price of the token can be highly volatile, potentially leading to significant price volatility for parties involved.

findings.title: MRM - Missing Revert Messages
findings.description: The contract is missing error messages. These missing error messages are making it difficult to identify and fix the issue.

findings.title: DDP - Decimal Division Precision
findings.description: Division of decimal (fixed point) numbers can result in rounding errors due to the way that division is implemented in Solidity, leading to issues with precise calculations with decimal numbers.

findings.title: RSK - Redundant Storage Keyword
findings.description: The contract uses the `storage` keyword in a view function which is redundant as view functions do not modify the state of the contract and do not perform any actions that cost gas.

findings.title: IDI - Immutable Declaration Improvement
findings.description: The contract is using variables that initialize them only in the constructor and are not mutated by other functions, but are not defined as `immutable`.

findings.title: L02 - State Variables could be Declared Constant
findings.description: State variables can be declared as constant using the constant keyword to ensure their values cannot be changed after being set, which decreases gas consumption.

findings.title: L04 - Conformance to Solidity Naming Conventions
findings.description: The code does not follow the Solidity naming convention guidelines, which can lead to decreased readability and maintainability.

findings.title: L07 - Missing Events Arithmetic
findings.description: Events are a way to record and log information about changes or actions that occur within a contract. They are often used to notify external parties or clients about events that have occurred within the contract, such as the transfer of tokens or the completion of a task.

findings.title: L16 - Validate Variable Setters
findings.description: The contract performs operations on variables configured by user-supplied input without proper checks for zero values, leading to potential problems during execution.

findings.title: L19 - Stable Compiler Version
findings.description: The contract uses a non-locked pragma version which may lead to unexpected behavior and undiscovered bugs when deployed with an incompatible compiler version.

findings.title: L20 - Succeeded Transfer Check
findings.description: According to the ERC20 specification, the transfer methods should be checked if the result is successful. Otherwise, the contract may wrongly assume that the transfer has been established.
